page.title: 11The Fort on Gourdon Hill
page.content: There is the remains of a possible {iron age fort on Gourdon Hill}near Middle Knox dating back to about 700BC-400AD. The shape of the fort is oval. The inside measurement is 79m by 36m. The fort was surrounded by a rampart on the northern side since this side of the fort was open to attack. The defence wall can now be made out as a mound of rubble. There were no walls on the south side because of the fairly steep natural slopes. Little remains of the fort but you can make out what was perhaps a {hut circle}made up of possibly 5 or 6 huts. There is a probable entrance midway along the NW side.
